subject: Design
title: Versailles: Excess as Political Design
description: Learn Versailles: Excess as Political Design in one minute.

hook.text: Versailles has 2,300 rooms, 67 staircases, and a hall of 357 mirrors. It wasn't vanity â€” it was strategy.

buildup.text: Louis XIV moved the French court to Versailles to control his nobles through proximity and spectacle.

discovery.text: Every room was designed to impress and intimidate. The Hall of Mirrors reflected candlelight endlessly.

twist.text: Nobles had to attend Versailles or lose favor. The interior was a gilded cage.

climax.text: Versailles proved that interior design could be a tool of political power, not just comfort.

punchline.text: The most famous palace in history was a prison disguised as luxury.

quiz.question: Why did Louis XIV build Versailles so lavishly?
options: To control nobles through spectacle and proximity
